rabbit.__comment: General RabbitMQ configuration. Define the exchanges and related queues. Note that it possible for more than one change to send messages to a queue through the 'exclusive' setting. The hierarchy in the structure of this file is an effort to make the process easier rather a set of strict rules.

transactionalExchange.__comment: Exchange - All transactional email events from the Drupal application go to this exchange.
transactionalExchange.name: transactionalExchange

transactionalQueue.__comment: Queue - Email events, queue items are used to generate single transaction request to Mandrill.
transactionalQueue.name: transactionalQueue

transactionalDigestQueue.__comment: Queue - transactional events, queue to gather transactions to generate a single digest message thats then sent to the transactionalQueue.
transactionalDigestQueue.name: transactionalDigestQueue

loggingQueue.__comment: Queue - Mongo based logging of all transactions.
loggingQueue.name: loggingQueue

directUserImport.__comment: Exchange - Summary email messages for allof a users campaign activity.
directUserImport.name: directUserImport

userImportQueue.__comment: Queue - User information imported from sources outside of DoSomething.org.
userImportQueue.name: userImportQueue

directLoggingGateway.__comment: Exchange - Gateway to all things logging and the mb-logging_api.
directLoggingGateway.name: directLoggingGateway

loggingGatewayQueue.__comment: Queue - User events from external applications
loggingGatewayQueue.name: loggingGatewayQueue

directDeadLetterExchange.__comment: Exchange - Log messages that encounter errors or some reason they can't be processed in their current state.
directDeadLetterExchange.name: directDeadLetterExchange

deadLetterQueue.__comment: Queue - Dead letters, where message go to die.
deadLetterQueue.name: deadLetterQueue

settings.__comment: Configuration settings for the Message Broker system.
